It‚Äôs very good size but great display view for my photo screensaver. It functions just as I imagined with great voice recognition and made out to be a great addition to my other Alexa devices.

product_title: Amazon Echo Show 8 (newest model), With Spatial Audio, Smart Home Hub, and Alexa, Charcoal
Review Title: Essential Device for the Elderly - Hands Free Calling for Help
Review Comment:
I am now a huge fan of Alexa. I've had several devices for years, just for the fun of it, but now I truly appreciate it as a life-saving device for the elderly. It is better than wearing a life-alert pendent--which studies show that the elderly will not wear, even when they have them. My sister has early stage dementia. We are committed to helping her live independently in her own home for as long as possible.  She is always misplacing her mobile phone, and then she goes into a panic.  Alexa to the rescue.  Now, if she falls, she can merely say, "Alexa, call for help." or "Alexa, call [first name] [last name]."

I got her 2 Echo Show devices: one for her bedroom and one for her living room.  Now, she can phone me through Alexa. She doesn't need to remember numbers or even operate her mobile.  I have written up commands for her to remind her that she must always say Alexa's name first.  Alexa will help her live independently and safely for longer.  The daily reminders that you can set are also important. I have set several reminders for her to take her night-time medicines.  And Alexa speaks the reminder aloud as well as shows the message on the screen.

Also, with Alexa Echo Show 5, 8, 10 etc. you can drop in on a loved one and see what's going on in their home.  It's like a nanny-cam. This is an invasion of privacy, but it essential in checking on an ill or disabled loved one, and you limit those who can drop in on you to just a few trusted caretakers and point the camera in a way to preserve personal dignity.  It gives the hearer a warning that someone is "dropping in" and they can block the intrusion, should they want.  I think you can drop in on the audio versions also (you just can't see anyone), but those would be appropriate in a bedroom or bath.

I'm still learning all the good things that Alexa will do.  It has a major learning curve, but once you set it up, it works beautifully--so long as your internet stays on.

Of course, adding Alexa means that big brother is watching you and listening in to your conversations.  If you watch a TV show with a character named Alexa (e.g. My Life is Murder on Acorn TV), then your device can be very annoying.  But you just say, "Alexa, stop."

These are small trade-offs for those of us who live alone and are getting up there in years. I'm telling everyone I meet who has an elderly parent about the importance of learning this resource.

product_title: Amazon Echo Show 8 (newest model), With Spatial Audio, Smart Home Hub, and Alexa, Charcoal
Review Title: Night and day upgrade from a Show 5!
Review Comment:
I had a Show 5 for many years and when I saw the price drop on the Show 8 3rd gen, $104, I couln't wait any longer. What a difference! Not only is the Show 8 display larger, the resolution is amazing! The display is bright, clear and the colors are true and bold. The sound on my Show 5 is muffled and not crisp and clear. The Show 8 sound is crisp, clear and full range. I have my Show 8 on my breakfast bar so I can listen to music while I am cooking. The sound fills my small apartment with pleasent, accurate music that is a joyful listening experience. The touchscreen requires only a light touch and is fast to respond. Unlike my Show 5, the Show 8 responds to my voice commands the first time even from 20 feet away. I still have my Show 5, however it has been moved to my bathroom with its small footprint.
  If you are looking for a medium sized smart speaker, with fast response, accurate color rendition, full range sound for your music and a budget friendly cost I would recommend considering the Echo Show 8 3rd gen. Paired with a tilt and swivel magnetic base makes it a choice you won't regret.

product_title: Amazon Echo Show 8 (newest model), With Spatial Audio, Smart Home Hub, and Alexa, Charcoal
Review Title: A Perfect Smart Display for Home Control and Entertainment
Review Comment:
I recently bought my Amazon Echo Show 8 and here are my thoughts in terms of its pros and cons:

It is a versatile smart display that offers excellent balance between size, functionality, and price. With its 8-inch HD screen, decent audio quality, and Alexa capabilities, it makes an ideal choice for both entertainment and smart home control. Here‚Äôs a closer look at the pros and cons of the Echo Show 8, particularly focusing on its smart home integration features.

### Pros

1. **Crisp Display**: The 8-inch HD screen is a great size for viewing content, checking recipes, and video calling. The screen is clear and responsive, making it easy to navigate.

2. **Decent Audio Quality**: It has better speakers than smaller Echo devices. Its sound quality is suitable for listening to music, podcasts, and watching videos with reasonable bass and clarity.

3. **Alexa Capabilities**: With Alexa, the Echo Show 8 can manage reminders, answer questions, play music, and control smart home devices. Alexa responds quickly to voice commands and is always improving.

4. **Smart Home Integration**: It integrates well with a wide range of smart home devices. It can control lights, thermostats, security cameras, and more. The screen makes it easy to view live feeds from compatible cameras, such as Ring doorbells, giving you real-time control over your home‚Äôs security.

5. **Video Calling**: The 13 MP camera allows for clear video calling, with features such as auto-framing that keeps you centered in the shot as you move. It works with Alexa-to-Alexa calling and supports Skype and Zoom.

6. **Privacy Controls**: Amazon includes privacy features, including a physical shutter to cover the camera and options to manage microphone and camera permissions, which is reassuring for privacy-conscious users.

### Cons

1. **Screen Resolution**: While the display is HD, it‚Äôs not as sharp as some high-end tablets or competing smart displays. Some users may find it adequate for the price, but others may wish for a higher resolution.

2. **Limited App Compatibility**: The Echo Show 8 supports streaming from platforms like Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, and Netflix, but it lacks native support for some other popular services, like Disney+.

3. **Occasional Lag**: Some users have reported occasional lag with certain features or apps. While it performs well for most tasks, the Echo Show 8 can feel slightly sluggish with more intensive usage.

4. **Heavy Amazon Ecosystem**: It is very much tied into the Amazon ecosystem, so users who aren‚Äôt invested in Alexa or Amazon services may find some limitations in their experience.

### Smart Home Integration

The Echo Show 8 really shines when it comes to smart home integration. Through Alexa, the device can connect to a broad array of smart home gadgets, including lights, plugs, cameras, and locks from popular brands like Philips Hue, Ring, TP-Link, and more. The screen enables unique capabilities, such as monitoring video feeds or managing device groups (e.g., turning off all lights in one room with a single command). Additionally, Alexa routines allow you to automate complex tasks across multiple devices, making it easy to personalize your home automation.

### Verdict

The Amazon Echo Show 8 is a strong choice for anyone looking to add a smart display to their home. It‚Äôs reasonably priced, offers solid performance, and integrates well with most smart home systems. While it‚Äôs not without its drawbacks, particularly regarding screen resolution and app limitations, the device remains a valuable addition to a connected home. Whether you‚Äôre new to smart displays or looking to upgrade, the Echo Show 8 offers a great balance of features and value.

product_title: Amazon Echo Show 8 (newest model), With Spatial Audio, Smart Home Hub, and Alexa, Charcoal
Review Title: A Compact Smart Display with Impressive Sound Quality
Review Comment:
I've been using the Amazon Echo Show 5 (3rd Gen, 2023 release) for a few weeks now, and I am thoroughly impressed with its performance. The Echo Show 5 has always been a reliable smart display, but this latest version truly steps up the game, especially in terms of sound quality.

**Sound Quality:**
One of the standout features of this Echo Show is its upgraded sound system. With 2x the bass and clearer sound than its predecessors, the audio quality is surprisingly robust for such a compact device. Whether I'm listening to music, catching up on the news, or watching videos, the sound is rich and immersive. It's perfect for smaller rooms, like the kitchen or bedroom, where you want good audio without the need for a larger speaker.

**Display and Design:**
The 5.5-inch screen is sharp and vibrant, making it great for watching short clips, checking the weather, or making video calls. The compact design fits easily on any shelf or counter, and the Charcoal color gives it a sleek, modern look that blends well with any decor. The screen's adaptive brightness is a nice touch, adjusting automatically based on the room's lighting.

**Smart Features and Alexa Integration:**
As expected from an Echo device, the Alexa integration is seamless. Voice commands are picked up easily, even from across the room, and the responses are quick and accurate. I use it to control my smart home devices, set reminders, and even follow along with recipes. The new smart display features also make it easier to see and control multiple smart home devices at once, which is a huge plus for someone like me who has a lot of them.

**Privacy and Security:**
Amazon has included a physical shutter for the camera, which provides peace of mind for those who are concerned about privacy. There's also a mic/camera off button, which is easy to use and effectively disables both the microphone and camera.

**Overall Performance:**
The Echo Show 5 (3rd Gen) is a fantastic addition to any smart home setup. It offers a great balance of audio quality, smart features, and privacy controls. Whether you're new to smart displays or looking to upgrade, this device is definitely worth considering. It's small but mighty, and I find myself using it more than I expected for everything from checking my calendar to watching cooking videos.

product_title: INSIGNIA 32-inch Class F20 Series Smart HD 720p Fire TV with Alexa Voice Remote (NS-32F201NA23)
Review Comment:
My previous TV, a flat-screen gifted to me in 2011, already ready to go, died last week. All of my adult life I have made do with hand-me-down or used TVs/monitors.

My dead TV was set up in my office so I could watch TV while working on the computer. I fed the TV with a laptop, via HDMI. I had previously poured a giant glass of ice-water on the laptop so the screen doesn't work very well, which made it perfect for feeding the TV.

I have large VOD libraries on both Prime Video and Vudu, so when looking at the Smart TV options, access to Vudu is important to me. So I originally decided against this TV because it's an Amazon Fire TV, and my Fire Tablet, (that I use to watch TV/movies in bed), doesn't allow me to put Vudu on it.

But when looking at all of the options, this one was the right size, and it does have HDMI inputs, so I could still feed it with my broken laptop, so it was the obvious choice, with the great sale price.

I searched the apps and found that Vudu was an option. I also downloaded Peacock, Paramount+, Movies Anywhere, Tubi, Plex, Crackle, MSNBC, The CW, ABC, NBC, CBS, and YouTube. Signing into to each of them on my computer and using codes worked really well. So the only thing I had to actually type my password into using the remote was my Wifi. It all works great, and switching to the HDMI input is easy, if I ever want or need to do that. Like if I ever want to watch something I only have on DVD or Blu Ray.

I will add Disney+, Hulu and Netflix when the WGA writer's strike is over and I resubscribe to them.

I don't know if my previous TV was HD, but when I've visited my parents when they've played Star Wars, Lord of the Rings and other things in HD on their HD TV and it has all looked gross. The Battle of Helms Deep was a bunch of amorphous clay blobs, and the Death Star was a bunch of dudes in bad costumes hanging out. I don't know if that was the motion smoothing thing that Tom Cruise was mad about a few years back, Either way, I've seen none of that gross stuff.

I've watch a little of the new Children of the Corn, several episodes of Stargate Atlantis, a little of Indiana Jones and the Crystal Skull and Jurassic Park, and it all looks good. If I look closely I can see what I'm guessing is filmgrain, but the picture is clear.

I recently watched an episode of Snoops (1999) that was uploaded to YouTube from probably VHS. There's a brief scene that features Dick Miller. I posted a screenshot to Twitter, but anyone who looked at that pic has to more or less take my word for it that it is indeed Dick Miller. But on this TV I could make guesses about the shade of lipstick worn by Teyla Emmagan, if I knew anything about lipstick.

This is all to let you know my level of knowledge so you can judge how my level of happiness would measure up to your level of happiness.

My only other observation in the few hours I've had this, is that the TV stands are at the outer edges of the TV. My previous TV had a big center stand, when meant I could perch it fairly near the edge of the table next to my desk, at a 45 degree angle (ish). So with the stands at the edges, I've had to push the TV farther back, and put sturdy things under the stands to give the TV better purchase on the table. Which is to say, you really need enough table under the entire TV to support it.

I saw a review that said their TV didn't come with the screws for the stands. Mine did. They were in a separate small bad, the same way the remote batteries were in a separate bag.

So far the TV seems absolutely great.

Although I do not need the smart features, I did set it up for that and everything works as it should. Set up was fairly easy as was connecting to my home WiFi.

For the money, if you need a tv this size, you can‚Äôt go wrong. I‚Äôve had 2-3 tvs by this brand and they have all worked pretty well. I give it a big seal of approval!

Review Comment: I was a little worried about getting a TV that only cost $80. But was i ever surprised. It had a beautiful picture,  easy setup,  all the apps you'd need and it's just such an improvement over the tv it replaced. I look so smart in my husband's eyes. Definitely would buy again.

product_title: INSIGNIA 32-inch Class F20 Series Smart HD 720p Fire TV with Alexa Voice Remote (NS-32F201NA23)
Review Comment: My 10 year old LC finally bit the dust. My intention was to get another LC because they are an excellent TV.  I saw this 24‚Äù advertised for $59, so what the heck. Keep in mind I installed this set only three days ago, but so far so good. 1. Setup was a breeze. It took maybe 30 minutes to unbox, and download all my TV apps. My LC was a solid 10 on picture quality, this set is a strong 8.5. If it lasts a few years for the price, it will be a no brainer. I am going to oder a 42‚Äù for my out dated garage TV. product_title: INSIGNIA 32-inch Class F20 Series Smart HD 720p Fire TV with Alexa Voice Remote (NS-32F201NA23)
Review Comment:
I bought this for my office at a great price.  The 720p picture is quite good, no need for 1080p for a 32" TV.  The native Fire TV app is a bit sluggish when compared to the Fire TV Stick 4k's and the 2nd & 3rd gen Cubes I own, but it is acceptable.

It has quite a few inputs for a TV at this price.  I even connected a ROKU Express 4K+ to one of the HDMI outputs and it works great, even snappier than the native Fire TV app.  I also ran a coaxial outside antenna connection and the TV's tuner picked up all of the available stations in my area without issue. I‚Äôm not sure if the OTA stations will work without a network connection to run the TV‚Äôs interface.  Didn‚Äôt try it.

I connected an old VCR to the TV‚Äôs composite audio/video inputs and the picture & sound is quite good (as can be expected.)

It would be nice if the TV had a selectable input or the option to default to the last used input when powered on.  It always defaults to its own Fire TV app.

I expected the TV to have lousy sound, but it is surprisingly good.  Plenty loud enough with a full sound.

Internal storage is good, I was able to install quite a few apps without running out of space.  However, when I was notified that my DirecTV streaming app had an update, the Fire TV app said there wasn‚Äôt enough room to install it.  I cleared the cache from several of the already installed apps and was then able to install the update.  So, for sure, not unlimited storage.

product_title: INSIGNIA 32-inch Class F20 Series Smart HD 720p Fire TV with Alexa Voice Remote (NS-32F201NA23)
Review Comment:
This is my first Fire TV and this is my experience.
After unboxing and plugging in there were quite a few updates and a bit of waiting around.  Accept this, opt out of that, updating system.

The user interface is intuitive and adding and rearranging the apps is supper simple.  Like all smart tvs, you search for your app. Add it and sign in.  To rearrange you click on the app you want to move and then use the remote to reorder.  Super intuitve.

Picture and color.
 It's a small tv and as such the clarity is great.  Pixl people understand.  Ther are several options foradjustments for viewing the picture, standard, movie, dynamic... I like mine set to movie.  I just watch tv and find that this setting is dark and rich.  Gamers would chose differently, I'm sure.  There is also the option to fine tune the pictures contrast, brightness....I found the factory choice of settings to be the best quality.  Resetting back to factory was a a button option on the same screen which took the fear factor of making adjustments out of the equation.

Sound
I was very surprised at how powerful the speaker were. I thought I would need a sound bar and expected to have to crank up the volume but alas I use a low sound settin.  I am watching from across the room and am hard of hearing.  Impressive.

Voice activated remote:
I didn't think much of this and never thought I'd use it.  I am now hooked and use it A LOT!

Conclusion:
I am so pleased with this tv sound and picture quality.  The housing of the tv is not at all premium and is in fact toy like.  For me the aesthetics is not an issue.  I am watching this from across the room as a bedroom tv.  For a secondary tv, THIS ROCKS!  I paid $69 for it.  Anything over $100 would be too much. for this pint sized television.

I highly recommend this for a bedroom or kitchen tv.
Happy viewing!

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
Review Title: Almost perfect.  Worth the price (on sale).
Review Comment:
I am a fairly heavy user of headphones and most recently have used AirPod Pro 2's.  I got the beats solo 4 on sale.

The sound is very good. The battery life is amazing. The blue color is nice. It is nice that it supports lossless audio via USB-C and also comes with both the USB-C cord and a 3.5 mm male to male cord.  They are also very light, and they charge very quickly.

They work great with Apple phones and other devices, including spatial audio. They pair easily. There isn't very much to complain about.

The only negatives that I have found so far is that it's not quite as convenient to switch between devices because it does not contain the Apple H1/H2 chip, and the clamping force of the headphones is a little too tight if you wear glasses. Hopefully that will loosen up on my particular headphones.

The lack of ANC is not a big deal. The earcups are very comfortable and they block out as much noise as a cheaper pair of ANC headphones. But, if you were looking for the sort of silence that you would receive from a more expensive pair of headphones, you probably should buy a more expensive pair of headphones.

The carrying case is nice and the headphones do fold to a fairly small size. They also seem fairly durable. The only discomfort that I have wearing them is from the clamping force; I don't know whether I have a larger small head, but I am about 6 feet tall and male. Maybe a smaller framed person would not have that difficulty.. I can wear them for a couple of hours and then it's time to give my head a rest.  I'd say for the price that I paid that is worth the trouble.

It's a common joke that beats headphones are typically found around people's necks.  I don't know whether that is true, but I can tell you that they are very comfortable around your neck. The smaller ear cups and general lightweight nature of this set of earphones make them a perfect candidate for wearing around your neck.

Finally, as a recent (and still) Apple snob, it is a little disappointing that the headphones don't know whether they are on your head or sitting on a chair, so they do not pause when you take them off.  Of course, they do not have any sort of passthrough sound capability.

If, like me, you are slightly disgusted that Apple failed to make any meaningful update to the Apple branded headphones that still cost an arm and a leg this year, these are a nice compromise, considering the price.

I saved the best for last and if you continued reading to this point, congratulations, because one of the things it is difficult to ascertain with an online purchase is microphone quality (for calls or voice recognition).  It is excellent, and the headphones sound at least as good as my AirPods Pro 2's for calls in both loud and quiet environments.

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
Review Comment:
I first picked up the Beats Studio Pros from Costco and tried them for two weeks. For being $350, they were terrible. My old "lower-quality" Sony noise canceling headphones performed better than the latest and greatest headphone? No way. So I returned it and swore off Beats products. Then I saw my sister was using the Beats Solo4s and tried them, expecting the StuidoPro experience. The sound quality greatly surpassed them and they fit snugly on my head. Impressed, I went on Amazon, found them at 50% off and picked them up. $200 is a bit overpriced imo for the features these include, but for $100 they're definitely worth it.

They are great for working out, a bit tight on your head, great fashion accessory, and sound fantastic for what they are especially without having noise canceling features. They keep out excess noise fairly well although I mostly use them at the gym. I have to take them off in order to hear someone if they talk to me. I got some sweat covers for the leather cushions so I would recommend that if you plan on sweating extensively with them like I do.

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
Review Comment: the beats are really good but when im on facetime it makes me sound muffled but overall it has good quality.

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
Review Title: Good Headphones for Most, but Not for Me
Review Comment:
It's been a while since I last owned a pair of Beats and I thought these would be better, when in reality, it was just more of the same. The only real good thing I can say about these is that they do, in fact, have great battery life and their design is sleek, but other than that, they just weren't for me.

These Beats Solo 4's do come with a carrying case along with the charging cable and an AUX cable for wired playback, which I appreciate. The headphones fold up compactly and they are easy to transport, but I do have one issue with the folding mechanism that I'll talk about later. The headphones are lightweight and small, and the design is great. The headphones are easy to adjust for your head size, and the ear pads have modest cushioning. The Bluetooth pairing is simple, and on my iPhone I was immediately prompted when they were powered on to connect them.

Now, let me talk about the sound quality. Unlike the older Beats which were mostly bass focused, in my opinion, these headphones were much more neutral with a flatter EQ that I generally prefer. It makes game audio richer when listening for enemies, it makes background instruments in songs more vibrant and focused, and it just allows you to hear things more how they truly sound. Except, something went wrong with the treble or the midtones or something as they were extremely sharp sounding. Most music sounds great and it is harder to notice this sharpness unless the volume is loud, but for listening to podcasts or watching online videos- that sharpness is extremely noticeable, especially in people with softer speaking voices as they sound almost whispy with sharp "s" and "t" sounds. These sharper voices almost make it sound like people or hissing as they talk and I just couldn't get over it. Admittingly, this issue is much less noticeable when using them wirelessly with my phone where I have more direct control of the EQ, but when using them wired on my PC or through my PlayStation controller, that ability to adjust the EQ diminishes. For movies or well produced content, some of that issue is more mild, but as a huge online content consumer, who mainly uses them wired, it was just not my taste. I know some won't have this issue, and I just might be more sensitive to it, but that was my experience.

Furthermore, we have to talk about my other complaints. First off, the hinge mechanism for holding the headphones is a bit dangerous if you have your hands near it when storing them, as I got my finger badly pinched a couple of times while doing just this. That may not be an issue for some, but I feel like I won't be the only person to experience that. Additionally, the comfort could be a bit better. Despite the headphones being lightweight, the clamping force on the ear cups is still very strong and after just an hour of wearing them I would begin to get migraines from the pressure. My head is fairly normal sized, and even when adjusting the headband to be looser, that experience didn't stop. The headband itself is also not that comfortable. The headband, which has a silicone-like padding, gets very thin and flattens out a lot as your body heat from your head warms it up. After a while, you will feel that the headband starts to sink a bit more into your scalp before it becomes uncomfortable. Once again, all of this is just my experience, but worth mentioning.

The main thing I can say is that the battery life is actually really good. They seem to charge quickly, and I haven't had issues with leaving the charger connected which destroyed one of my older Beats Studios from years ago. The battery seems to last forever as you scroll through videos, watch movies and play mobile games before that recharge is necessary.

Overall, I ultimately returned these headphones. Not because they were bad, but just because they weren't a good fit for me. The sharpness in some voices over the wired connection was hard to ignore, and the migraine inducing pain from the poor comfort also wasn't worth the subpar experience I was having. While these headphones may still be great for a lot of people, I had to share my thoughts to be as honest as possible.

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue

product_title: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
Review Title: Great balance between performance and affordability.
Review Comment:
I was looking to upgrade from my AirPods and found these headphones to be a great alternative. The ear pads are soft and comfortable, even though they‚Äôre not over-ear pads, which was a concern for me initially. They don‚Äôt cause any soreness during shorter listening sessions, but after 2-3 hours, you might start to feel some pressure and need to adjust them for better comfort.

One of the standout features is the seamless connectivity with my MacBook and iOS devices, making switching between them hassle-free. They also support Apple‚Äôs Spatial Audio, which enhances the listening experience, especially for music and movies designed for immersive sound.

While they don‚Äôt include active noise cancellation, which would have been a nice addition, the extended battery life more than compensates for it. I‚Äôve been impressed by how long they last on a single charge, making them reliable for long workdays or travel.

Overall, these headphones strike a great balance between performance and affordability. If you‚Äôre seeking an upgrade with solid features like Spatial Audio and great battery life, these are worth considering, even without noise cancellation.

product_title: Apple AirPods 4 Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, USB-C Charging
Review Title: Great Sound and Convenience, Just a Few Minor Quirks
Review Comment:
I recently purchased the Apple AirPods 4, and overall, I‚Äôm really impressed! The sound quality is exceptional, with clear highs and rich bass that elevate my listening experience. The convenience of the wireless design makes them perfect for everyday use, whether I‚Äôm at the gym or just out for a walk.

The battery life is another standout feature; I can easily get through a full day without needing to recharge. The seamless integration with my Apple devices is also a big plus, allowing for quick pairing and easy switching between devices.

However, I do have a couple of minor complaints. The fit isn‚Äôt as snug as I would like, which can lead to them slipping out during more vigorous activities. Also, while the touch controls are handy, they can be a bit sensitive at times, leading to accidental pauses or skips.

Overall, I highly recommend the AirPods 4 for anyone looking for high-quality wireless earbuds. Just be mindful of the fit and controls, and you‚Äôll be very happy with your purchase!

product_title: Apple AirPods 4 Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, USB-C Charging
Review Title: They fall out of your ears easily and might not work well with older Iphones
Review Comment:
Order these for my Iphone 10XS.  I wanted the latest generation of Earbuds to make sure down the road when I get my Iphone 17 they would work great.
Ran into 2 problems,  I had an issue with the 10XS,  the earbuds kept cutting out.  Plus they kept falling out of my ears.  When I contacted Apple about the problems, I was told the 4th edition earbuds will fit the average ear but some people have issues with them falling out.  It was suggested I purchase the Pro versions which have adapters that fit directly on them to make the fit into your ear better.  They also suggested that I update my Iphone to the latest IOS edition which I did and it made the cutoff better but not 100% gone.  Anyway,  I returned them and will look a purchasing the Pro models.
If you considering an Earbud purchase I suggest going to a place where you can actually try them in your ears to see how well they fit before you buy! I will say when they were working (and not falling out) they had great sound!

product_title: Apple AirPods 4 Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, USB-C Charging
Review Comment: They fit very well, but if you keep them in for too long and your ears get really oily they tend to slip out and hurt your ears. I‚Äôve played basketball in them on multiple occasions and have not had them slip out. In some instances i forget they are even in my ear. they sound great for the price and the case is small so it isnt bulky in your pockets. Overall a solid set of earbuds

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
This is my first ever owned Echo Speaker, however...

Design: I honestly fell in love with the design. I think it's very modern and the way it incorporates the clock with the speaker is very well done.

Sound: I'm honestly impressed by the sound quality. It is very loud, crisp and clear. It isn't the ABSOLUTE loudest or best speaker out there, however, it performs incredibly well. The bass very good and very present for such a small device.

Alexa: The Alexa feature on it is amazing. Very versatile with what you can do with it and it's very responsive as well. I love that you can control so many things with it if you have the right accessories.

Screen: At first glance I though the whole top portion was a screen, but it's only a small square in the center. The screen itself is very bright and pleasing to look at. Touch screen is very responsive and decently customizable, from color to clock format, but I wish it had a few more options for how you want the clock to look like, though, it's not an issue at all.

Connectivity: Very seamless and easy to handle with your phone (Alexa App). There are many options on how to use your Echo Spot and though I've only gone through a few, I've seen the rest of the things I can use the app for, and it is so versatile. I'm sure WiFi connectivity matters when it comes to response time between your phone and the Echo, but the response time was very quick in my experience.

Cord: It brings a decently long cord. Would be nice if the plug was a bit less bulky, but again, minor inconvenience, not an issue at all.

Overall, this is a solid product and I highly reccomend it if you've never had one. I did buy it with a few things in mind though. I wanted to get the most out of it, so I did order a fan and some light bulbs to control with it, and I can see myself wanting to get other things to use my Echo Spot with, however, the speaker on its own is still a great Smart Speaker/Clock.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
Let me start out by saying, these things are a breeze to setup up. All you do is download the app and follow the on-screen instructions. I had no issues setting up either one of the devices I bought and they both connected to my wifi flawlessly. I love the professional looking display and voice commands work very well aswell.

Also, the sound quality on these is pretty good considering the cost. Sound quality isn't JBL Charge level good but it's definitely better than phone speakers. They are loud, clear, and even have eq settings you can set through the app. You can even set these Echos up to play music through all of your Amazon related devices at the same time which can be useful and save you a ton of money.

Prior to purchasing these gadgets, I read mixed reviews on a lot of the things I mentioned, but I haven't experienced any issues. Some of the settings can be a pain to find, but overall, the app will walk you through setup step by step what you need to do to get them working and connected to your wifi. If you have connection issues, you need to check your network settings or your wifi range.

My 2 complaints are, 1) the devices came caked in dust even though the box was sealed; and 2) the buttons could feel a little higher quality. I don't use the buttons at all due to voice commands and control through the app, but that may be an issue for some users.

Something else I noticed was the horrible reviews linking the devices to Spotify. I didn't have these reported issues myself, so they could've been fixed with a firmware update, but it's definitely worth mentioning.

I feel like a lot of these issues people are having are either network issues, or user related issues. If you take your time and follow the on-screen instructions, you won't have any issues. At the very least, my experience was great with them and yours will be too. I highly recommend this product.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment: Purchased this when it was on sale for $45 and would recommend waiting for a sale to snag it at that price point. $80 just seems a little high for what it is. Besides the price point, this is a great little device with a very nice-looking screen. I wanted something a bit more simplified for the bedside to not cause distractions, as I don't need to see what's new on Netflix like on an Echo Show. Of course, Alexa integration works flawlessly with my other devices and home setup. Sound is actually pretty impressive with nice bass to boot. I have this set to start my morning with my Apple Music Playlist and it works great. Very much recommend, just wait for the sales that happen a few times a year.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
*In attached picture the clock numbers look blue/teal, they aren't, that's just the way the low light in my room makes it look when I took a picture, it does not look like that in real life!

I love the quality of this, it is amazing, something you would expect from an amazon device. It is easy to use, you just talk to it and it listens (the touch screen works but i haven'tused it besides to cancel an alarm when it is going off). The sound quality is great too alot of people say the dot is so much better, I really don't notice a difference when playing 80s & 90s Country Music, it still fills the room even if it is not pointed directly at me. The display, it is great, way better than I though, it looks tiny in the pictures but in real life the screen is actually pretty large! In full light the bezel makes it look like the full upper half is a screen. I like that it shows the date, time, and weather on the screen, and how the display goes to a red at night if you have night mode enabled, it is way less bright then.

2 common complaints I don't have.

‚Ä¢ Doesn't default to homescrewn when playing music, well it is meant for your night stand where you are 2 feet away from it, you would be able to see the small clock, if you need it to go to the home screen just say "Alexa, go home."
‚Ä¢ Alarm auto snoozed, no it doesn't, just disable tap gestures, that's where the problem is. I have not yet had this happen to me and I set an alarm for 6am every morning.

This is a great device, I've had it since the beginning of October 2024, I love it! Way better than echo dot with clock! I definitely recommend it to anyone reading this!

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
I have two of these devices and am very pleased with them. They are alarm clocks but with the power of Alexa running them. I can play music to help me fall asleep and they control my smart switches. I'm not a fan of routines, but I do like a device that can answer questions or respond to requests.

These devices cannot play videos which also means they do not show ads. I get tired of Amazon showing me offers of items I just happen to mention in conversation with others (but when asked, Alexa says she doesn't spy on me, good to know). Echo Spots are compact and fit well with any counter or nightstand. I own a blue and a white Spot and I may buy another at some point when Amazon has special pricing, which typically drops the price to $44. On sale they are a very good deal and for a small device the speakers sound good, at least good enough. Settings allow me to dim the screen at night and there are several choices on how to display the time.

I'm glad Amazon came up with this design over the earlier Echo Dot with a clock, which was never easy to view. The speakers aren't as powerful as the full-size Echo, but given its compactness, it has its niche in the Echo lineup.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Title: New Echo Spot 2024 - Not just for the bedroom.
Review Comment:
Seems to me the marketing of this new Echo is pitched to be used in the bedroom as a modern version of the old nightstand alarm clock radio.  Which it absolutely is.  And a great version of that.  It displays a few cool versions of the clock to choose from.  It includes day/night indicator, temperature, weather icon, day, date and month.  And looks really sleek and unobtrusive.

But this little bad boy is so much more.  We use it in the family room / living room.  It‚Äôs that good looking.  The microphone is improved over previous versions, so it can hear commands clearly from across the room.  And the sound for music is phenomenal.

I got it as an upgrade from an older model and am very happy I upgraded.  Would highly recommend.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Title: Great Alarm Clock and Echo speaker Combo
Review Comment: Our (not smart) radio alarm clocks were acting up. Picked up 3 of these on sale during Prime Days. They work great. Setup alarms to a local radio station (online radio streaming only) and works with smart light switch and can auto turn on lights in morning when alarm goes off. Its sound quality is close to Echo Dot. There is no ads. (Purchased Echo Show 5 originally, and they force ads). It shows Clock, weather, and/or date all the time. This also works great in kids room, to make sure they don't turn off their alarms, as you can check with the Alexa app on your phone. There is no way of locking the clock, but you can change Alexa trigger word and turn off the mic.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
The 2024 Echo Spot is a fantastic smart devise for your home that seamlessly combines functionality with modern design. Its compact size and sleek black finish fit effortlessly into any bedroom decor.

One of the standout features is the vibrant sound quality. Whether you‚Äôre waking up to your favorite tunes or enjoying a podcast, the audio clarity is impressive for such a small device. The adjustable display is also a highlight, offering a crisp, colorful screen that's easy to read, even from across the room.

Alexa integration makes this device truly versatile. Setting alarms, checking the weather, and controlling smart home devices are just a voice command away. The customizable clock faces add a personal touch, letting you choose what suits your style.

In terms of usability, the Echo Spot is user-friendly and intuitive. The touchscreen interface is responsive, making navigation simple and enjoyable. The snooze function is perfect for those mornings when you need just a few extra minutes.

Overall, the Echo Spot is not just an alarm clock; it‚Äôs a multifunctional hub that enhances your daily routine. Whether you‚Äôre an avid tech enthusiast or just looking for a reliable alarm clock, this device exceeds expectations. Highly recommended!

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Title: If you want a nightstand Echo clock, this is the one to get
Review Comment:
I've been an early Alexa adapter (even made several apps for it) but I've been struggling to find a good one for a bedside table. The first round Echo Spot was neat but painfully slow, and also tried to fit a square UI in a round space.

So I switched to the 5in Show...which was a mistake. While the device is nice, it often failed to switch to "night mode" which meant it was a blazing beacon next to my bed all night. But what was worse was how it would cycle to ads or information often and then hide the time in the corner, which is what I wanted it for. I moved it to an office where it worked better.

This is the best one because it solves almost all the 5 shows problems. First off: NO ADS. No random cycling on the screen, it just shows the time. It's exactly what I wanted.

Second, it has a much better night mode. Not only does it actually fire off, it changes the time to red (which doesn't impar night vision) which is fantastic.

Next, no camera. It can't spy on you. Thank goodness.

Lastly, the it still does screen features (it's a touchscreen). Stuff like timers can still show, your next alarm can show, and you can adjust alarms with the touch features.

I do have a few minor gripes. The sound quality is just...passable, not incredible, but honestly Echo devices across the board have had dimishing sound quality with each new iteration. On that same note, I swear Alexa is getting dumber every update. Luckily I mostly just build my own routines for smart home stuff and thus don't ask her very many questions, but even getting her to recognize simple commands has become less reliable.

Regardless, if you have a smart home and need a voice device in your bedroom and also want a clock this one is great. I may even get another one for the guest bedroom.

product_title: All-new Amazon Echo Spot (2024 release), Great for nightstands, offices and kitchens, Smart alarm clock with Alexa, Black
Review Comment:
I set the alarm for 6:30 AM and before it goes off it automatically sets itself into snooze and adds 9 minutes to my set time. When it gets closer to its own set time of 6:39 it happens again and adds another 9 minutes to the alarm time. This happens continuously for a hour and 20 minutes so an alarm I set for 6:30 AM goes off at 7:50 AM. This is unacceptable. A alarm clock that you can‚Äôt depend on is worthless.

I called Amazon tech services and they had me reset the Spot back to factory settings and set it up again. Then we tested it by setting alarm for 2 minutes ahead and it worked so we thought it was fixed. So the next day I set the alarm for 6:30 AM weekdays and this morning it went off at 7:50 AM. Junk !!! I‚Äôve checked everything in the Alexa app and have tried setting the 6:30 AM alarm up using the app as well setting by voice. It doesn‚Äôt matter the 6:30 AM alarm goes off at 7:50 AM.

I give up and returning this worthless alarm clock.

Update: Amazon Outreach Department contacted me about the problems we were having with the Echo Spot alarm. It seems some other people were having the same problem. We run fans at night and the Echo Spot tap feature was on. They asked me to turn off the tap feature in the Alexa app. We did and now the alarm has worked perfectly ever since.

They said there seems to be a correlation between fans running and the tap feature on causing the Spot to reset the set alarm time into snooze mode automatically.

We have a 2nd Echo Spot which wasn‚Äôt set up for an alarm so I tested it. On Monday I set its alarm for 7:30 AM with the tap feature on and the bedroom fans on.
Sure enough the alarm failed and it set itself on snooze mode for over 30 minutes.
So on Tuesday I set the alarm for 7:30 AM with the tap feature off and the fans running. It worked perfectly and went off at exactly 7:30 AM and no snooze problems. Problems solved !!

I don‚Äôt care if the tap feature is off in the Alexa app, just tell it to snooze by voice and it works perfectly and only snoozes for 9 minutes.

I have reported my findings to Amazon as they are working to figure out why this is happening. There seems to be a correlation between the tap feature on and fans running in the room.

Anyway the Spot alarm works perfectly now on both Spots and we love the Echo Spot now and everything it does.

I want to thank Amazon for actually caring and reaching out to me and working together to fix this alarm problem. I was going to return them but now they work perfectly and we really like this device so I‚Äôm canceling the return.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Title: Compact size, nice bezel to grip, less glare!
Review Comment:
I was hoping for an Oasis replacement with this new launch, but sadly we didn‚Äôt get another device with premium finishes and page turn buttons. The Scribe is too big for me, I sent it back after 2 days, and it wasn‚Äôt worth purchasing another Paper White just for the color screen, especially when I was already a bit dissatisfied with the paper white signature edition I already have. The paper white bezel is very narrow all the way around, and it makes it a little tedious to hold.

The basic kindle is great to hold onto for hours at a time. It‚Äôs weighs very little, and I love the bezel. There‚Äôs no glare on the bezel because of the textured matte finish, which also means the bezel is not constantly covered in finger prints. Dark mode works great. There‚Äôs no flashing between page turns. I don‚Äôt personally miss the automatic light adjustment, because I usually had to adjust it myself anyway. I don‚Äôt miss the waterproofing because I don‚Äôt usually take my kindle anywhere near the water. (And if it does get wet it‚Äôs not too expensive to replace.) I‚Äôve never used the wireless charging on my paperwhite, so I don‚Äôt miss that. I don‚Äôt even really notice the screen being smaller. I do wish it had the warm light, but it‚Äôs not a deal breaker for me. It‚Äôs worth it to have a device that‚Äôs lightweight, has a good bezel to hold onto, and isn‚Äôt constantly covered in fingerprints.

Overall it‚Äôs wonderful to hold for extended periods of time. The matcha color is beautiful, and the matching case is very nice!

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Comment: This is such a great kindle! It‚Äôs lightweight, the perfect size for going in a purse or bag, and the matcha is SUCH a great color.  I already have a Paperwhite SE that I love, so I decided to get this kindle for travel purposes. The battery life isn‚Äôt as great as my Paperwhite, but it still lasts me a while with daily reading! It fits perfectly in my hands and makes reading very comfortable. The only thing it is missing is the warm light option, but that is not a deal breaker for me. If you are looking for a lightweight and comfortable kindle, this is the one for you.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Title: better than 2023 Kindle Paperwhite Signature edition
Review Comment:
I was hesitant to pull the trigger on this new kindle as I only just purchased my paperwhite signature in August. Prior to that I had the basic kindle from 2019. While I love the paperwhite and its features, I quickly found that it can be fairly uncomfortable and awkward to hold compared to my old 6 inch kindle. It is also noticeably heavier.

I ultimately decided to purchase this new kindle and as soon as I took it out of the box I knew I made the right call. I purchased the matcha color, which I was hesitant to do because I didn‚Äôt really love how it looked in the pictures but also didn‚Äôt want just plain black. I am SO glad I chose the matcha. It isn‚Äôt as vibrant as it appears in the ad photos which I really like. It is very similar to the agave green paperwhite color. I also love that the whole device is the same color rather than just the back being colored.

As for the page turning speed, I don‚Äôt see much of a difference between this kindle and the previous paperwhite model. The page turning wasn‚Äôt something that ever bothered me, but they really emphasized this ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù in the advertising so I was hoping for more. But again, certainly not a deal breaker for me.

In terms of the difference in features between this model and the paperwhite, I don‚Äôt feel as though I am missing out on much. The one feature I would have loved to see on this kindle that the paperwhite has is the adjustable warmth of the screen color.

Overall, I definitely think that I will be reaching for this kindle more than the paperwhite given how compact and light this model is. It is very comfortable and easy to hold and the color is just perfect. I would recommend this model over a paperwhite.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Comment:
I love my new Kindle. It fits into my life perfectly. My five year old Kindle Paperwhite was getting to seem slow and cumbersome. (The newest model of the Paperwhite is now even larger than the old.) I wanted something smaller. This Kindle is just right‚Äîeasy to hold, easy to use, light and fast.

I got a new type case for it that is like a phone case. It is also lightweight which makes the Kindle so very portable. It fits in my smaller purses and works with a 5000mAh power bank that is also portable. Now I can read anywhere with a book size screen.

And I found an adorable sea turtle holder that I can use when reading at my desk or dining table. The turtle holds the tablet securely and does not cover the screen.

So, I am now set for reading pleasure for the next five years.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Title: Good reading experience, on par with Kobo Clara BW
Review Comment:
I traded in my 2020 Papwerhite on this standard Kindle and find the design better for reading. the bezel allows for easier holding of the device and I see no difference in the quality of backlight compared to my old Paperwhite. I also have a 2024 Kobo Clara and there is very little difference in the two devices - the lighting is good on both, the weight is very slightly less on the Kindle, although not by enough to matter, and the speed is equivalent on both devices.

As far as usability, the Kindle is locked to Amazon's system, so if you get books from Google, Kobo, or Barnes and Noble, you won't be able to read them on this device without stripping the DRM, which is illegal. That said, you can borrow books from your local library if you first go to the library web page and check the book out. Then you designate that you want to read it on your Kindle and link your Amazon account, at which time it will show up in your books. On the Kobo Clara, you can browse and borrow books directly from the library, which I find more convenient.

Battery life on the two devices seems comparable as well. I have not seen a measurable difference when reading with the wifi turned off (unless I'm syncing, I have it turned off) Page turns also seem identical, which is a big improvement over the older Paperwhite I had before. The home screen and settings are easier to use and navigate on the Kobo Clara, but if you are used to the Kindle interface, nothing will have changed. It looks much the same as my very old Kindle Touch.

This device does not have page turn buttons (neither does the Kobo Clara BW) so if you want that feature, you'll have to get the more expensive models, but both have USB C charging via cable, which is nice. I can finally recycle the last of the old charging cables! You cannot service any aspect of this reader, which is not a huge problem for me, but I still think owners should be able to replace batteries or screens on devices that come with a price tag like this, but that's another discussion entirely. For what it's worth, the Kobo Clara is user-serviceable, just sayin'!

Cost-wise, I chose the Kindle over the Paperwhite because I did not see the value in spending that much more for a few minor features. The screen resolution is fantastic and the size makes it far more portable than the larger Paperwhite. Even with the case on, I can fit this into a back pocket or jacket pocket easily.

Overall, this is a solid choice for an e-reader, although I find that since I get books from different places, having two devices is required (Kindle for Amazon books, Kobo for all other sources) If you want the specific features the Paperwhite has, are OK with paying that much more for them, this might not be the choice for you. Otherwise, this is a solid choice (and at least you can get it in a decent color!)

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Comment:
This is THE cutest Kindle! The matcha is a nice muted color, and looks cute with the matching Kindle case. There is no warm light on this Kindle. I was a little afraid about that, because I have issues reading on white pages, no matter which digital medium. I did turn the white lighting down and the brightness, and was able to find a setting that was ok. Then I tried the dark mode and thought "There!" I love it. It's easy on the eyes, and the white text isn't blaring white, it is also muted. Perfect on the eyes.

There is glare when a light is behind you. I bought an anti-glare screen protector. All set!

This Kindle is so very light. It can easily fit in a small bag. I really look forward to enjoying reading on it.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Title: Cute color, but some ghosting issues.
Review Comment:
I‚Äôve had a kindle since 2013 ‚Äî it was a refurbished paperwhite 2. It is still going strong, but with its lack of space after 10+ years of collecting books, and upgrades in screen quality on new devices, I was ready to upgrade. When I saw this new basic release, I was excited! I really wanted the agave paperwhite se, but I felt I could not justify the price tag with my ‚Äúancient‚Äù kindle still working well. (It just couldn‚Äôt hold many books! And the lag and crashes were getting annoying.) Along comes this basic and I think for that price, why not try it out?

Well, the first one arrives and the ghosting is pretty bad. Customer service did their best but we decided to exchange it. I was assured the replacement would NOT ghost. Got the replacement today and sadly there is still a little ghosting‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs barely there. I‚Äôm worried it will become worse as I use it. So far the book pages refresh well enough that it isn‚Äôt a noticeable issue while reading, but it gets irritating when I am navigating menus or doing a quick settings change. But I suppose it‚Äôs a basic ‚Äî maybe I am just expecting paperwhite quality from a basic? Still, it‚Äôs wild to me that a 2024 kindle is out performed by a 2011 one ‚Äî a refurbished one at that!

If the issue worsens, or a firmware update somehow fixes things, I will update this review. But for now, all I can say is temper your expectations. I‚Äôm not sure I want to deal with another exchange (or even sure they‚Äôll do another tbh). I just want to read my books!

Otherwise, the color is cute, the size is lovely for me, and I am pleased with the rest of the promised features. The space is enough to hold my whole collection, even with my non-fiction and reference books. The contrast is good, I love the matte screen and how sharp everything looks. The lighting is much more even than my 2011 kindle has. Even with a case, it‚Äôs so light. (I am very hypermobile and even ‚Äúlightweight‚Äù things can hurt after even a short session.) I am aware eInk can ghost, based on its very nature. But again. Why is it worse in 2024 than 2011?

11/3/24 ‚Äî update: i am now able to get my kindle on a newer firmware. it has helped slightly with the ghosting. there is still some present, but it is not so pronounced.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Comment: I got this new basic Kindle as soon as it came out. I've owned several different kinds of Kindles through the years and kept coming back to just the basics. I like how comfortable it is to hold and can fit in pockets, small purses, etc. This new version is fast to turn pages and the reading lighthing is perfect, it even has dark mode just like my Oasis. My only thing that I am still getting used to is the battery life. I am used to not charging my Kindle for weeks (Oasis & Paperwhite) but with this kindle basic I find that I have to charge every couple of weeks with daily reading use. Not a deal breaker thou. Nevertheless, I still love it. It is perfect for me, does the job of an eReader, and most of all I paid less than half the price from a trade in cost plus 20% off. Sweet deal.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Comment:
This is my fifth Kindle, as I upgrade every four years. This one is faster and more responsive than all previous versions. It's a small enough size to fit in my pocket for reading on the go, and it has tons of storage to carry hundreds of books with me. The new Frustration-Free Setup feature is the bomb! Just turn it on, link to an existing device, and it automatically sets itself up. Bravo, Amazon!
Picked it up on Black Friday week sale plus 20% off in addition for the trade-in of an older Kindle, making it a very reasonable price and an easy decision to buy it. I failed to by a protective case for my last purchase and the exterior corners of that Kindle all were damaged by drops and bumps. Bought a case this time. Gained both protection and extra grip to prevent the slick exterior of  my Kindle jumping out of my hand. Highly recommended for avid readers.

product_title: New Amazon Kindle (16 GB) - Lightest and most compact Kindle, with glare-free display, faster page turns, adjustable front li
Review Title: Can I Give More Than 5 Stars?!?!?
Review Comment:
Here I thought I would never give up paper back books, but I AM LOVING my kindle. I always swore I would never get a kindle, but now I could never go without it. I would much rather carry my small kindle around VS carrying a 500 page page and having the weight in my bag.

I use the app on my phone as well which is super nice because they sync together. I do take advantage of Kindle Unlimited and I LOVE IT. This is so much cheaper than paying for books. They download instantly to my library and I can return them when I am done. No worrying about books laying around!

Best part - You can see what page you are on, you can see HOW MANY MINUTES are left of the chapter and how many are left of the book!

I have so far converted my friend, my mom and my sister AWAY from paper back books and onto Kindles!

100/10 recommend making the switch!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment:
I have had my Kindle for over a month, and I am still excited about this Kindle. However, I just saw that it is on sale (Black Friday Deal), and I wanted to cry. It is now $45 less than what I paid (excluding the cost of the charger and case; add another $60 to that $45 (Ouch!)).

Then, I had to have a talk with myself, and it went like this: Trinigal, stop being upset! You are fortunate to have purchased a Kindle that works well, and doesn‚Äôt have issues (like others who have shared the dissatisfaction with their Kindle).
You are still enjoying your reads and always looking forward to your next read. I then chuckled to myself, and said that the title of the next book I select should be: When is the right time to buy a Kindle?

My original review is below:

This is my first Kindle, so I don‚Äôt have any other Kindle to compare it to. I usually read a physical book, books on my Computer, IPad or iPhone. This Kindle makes a difference in my ability to relax while reading a book. It is an awesome device that is portable, light weight, and convenient.

Although I like reading on my IPad, it will no longer be my go to device for reading (When you know better, you do better).

My house is full of unread books that I bought over the years, and that really bothers me because I just couldn‚Äôt find the time to read (being a professor with lots of other academic books to read, I gave those academic books priority over a good novel). Now, I am at the point where I want to read books for relaxation purposes. I chose the Kindle Paperwhite Signature edition as part of my incentive to read a good book.

I researched this Kindle for an entire month before investing in it.

Let‚Äôs get to the workings of the Kindle:

This 7 inch Kindle is easy to hold in my hands. The IPad truly strained my hand when I tried to use only one hand when reading. At times, I had to lean the IPad on my thighs for support. Now, there will be no more hand to thighs when reading!

The Kindle set up was very easy, and user friendly. I did not experience any problems connecting to the internet.

After set up, with bated breath, I waited to see how the pages turned on the Kindle, and if I will find any fault with the action of turning the pages of the book I was reading. I am happy to say there was none; no noticeable long lag time, no problems were experienced with the turning of pages on this Kindle.

Then I squinted my eyes, opened my eyes wide, I turned the Kindle upside down, and side to side while turning to the next page of  my book; I was trying to see if there will be any trace of the previous page as I turn to the next page ( ghosting; some users experience an imprint of the former page while moving to the next page of their book). Happy to report, I tried hard to find a problem with that but I found none.

What about the battery?
The battery charged very quickly, and there was no problem during that process. I did charge the battery with the case on the Kindle, (as the picture shows). The Kindle came with an 80% charge and in 30 minutes (or less) it was fully charged (100%).

I am hardly ever swayed by reviews:
Sometimes reviews work as an incentive, or a deterrent‚Ä¶.I always say, try an item out and make your personal decision.
This Kindle is a keeper, and I am also going to purchase the new Color Kindle Colorsoft.

Conclusion:
This Kindle paper white Signature Edition , Gen 12/32 GB, is truly made for reading. It is certainly a handy device for traveling, and reading on the go. It is easy on the eyes, and therefore, easy on the brain. The raspberry color is really nice, and I plan on buying an extra clear case so that I could easily see the vibrant color of the kindle.

I am honestly excited to be part of the Kindle family!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Title: Excellent clarity and blazing speed; a worthy upgrade.
Review Comment:
The screen has excellent sharpness and contrast, the best of any ereader I've ever seen in person. It brings to mind another device that featured strikingly good sharpness and contrast despite the layers over the screen: The Voyage. I don't have one on hand to do a direct comparison, but it certainly seems to have that same sort of secret sauce going for it. I'll be very interested to see some direct comparisons from people who still have a Voyage on hand. It's not as apparent in photos, but I'm surprised at how much sharper it is than my 2021 PW. I knew from the early reviews that it would be better, but I wasn't expecting it to be so noticeable. Even my beloved Oasis comes up short in a direct comparison!

Much has been made of the speed of this iteration of the PW, and it's not just empty hype. I never thought the word "fast" would ever really apply to an e-ink screen due to the limitations of the technology, but the Kindle team has made that a reality. Pages turn as quickly as I can tap the screen, and while I've never cried out to the heavens about page turns being too slow, it's impressive to see such responsiveness on an e-ink screen. The true benefits of this speed come into play when navigating menus, adjusting settings, and especially when typing. I honestly did not think it was possible for an e-ink screen to be so fast and responsive. This is truly impressive. The speed in itself is not a reason to upgrade to this model, but if you're already considering an upgrade, it is definitely an extra enticement.

Despite the larger screen, it's very nearly the same size, measuring about a millimeter taller and wider. Annoyingly, it's just enough that the device won't fit in cases made for the 2021 model. (At least, neither of the ones I have.)

The back of the device feels very similar, just a bit slick. I still have no difficulty holding onto it. The power button is still on the bottom, and though I understand why some are annoyed by this, it's never been an issue for me. I've been using Kindles for thirteen years, and while about five of those saw me primarily using an Oasis, that's still a good eight years I used various basic and PW models. In all that time, I don't recall ever pressing the power button by mistake. So I get why it's a point of irritation for some, but it's not a mark against the device for me.

I have a Colorsoft on order, and this PW was intended as an early Xmas gift for my mom. While I set it up for her, I just couldn't resist playing around with it a bit, and it has really won me over. If I wind up not keeping my Colorsoft, I'll definitely be getting one of these for myself. The improvements are mostly small, but those little things add up to a noticeably superior experience. Despite the lack of page turn buttons, which I truly love, it just may supplant my Oasis as my main reader!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Title: Total Nightmare! QC is garbage! Return process the worst in the Industry
Review Comment:
Shopping for a new Kindle is like playing Russian roulette. You‚Äôre taking a huge gamble, taking on a big risk because the quality control is absolute garbage now at Amazon. Amazon is literally going backwards with the Kindle. This is my second Paperwhite and it‚Äôs even worse than the first. I figured why not take another chance on the premium Kindle Paperwhite signature edition thinking that it‚Äôll somehow be better, not the case. It‚Äôs even worse than the standard Paperwhite which was really bad to begin with. As a comparison, I have my Kindle Paperwhite 7th generation from 2015 that is leaps and bounds much better than this garbage new edition.

Now for a little background‚Ä¶

I have owned every Kindle starting from 2014 when I got the Voyage. Right off the bat the new Kindle Paperwhite has an overly yellow screen, meaning that the light is significantly yellow. It‚Äôs not white, it‚Äôs not even subtly opaque. But YELLOW! To make things worse, the screen lighting isn‚Äôt even even. It‚Äôs has a darker yellow band towards the bottom of the screen. This is not only my device, but across the board. This is confirmed across multiple websites, including YouTube and Amazon reviews on here. So the lighting issues not only affect the new Kindle Colorsoft, which is getting absolutely flamed for the same issue, but it also affects the new Paperwhite.

The other issue is that all new Kindles no longer support Apple computers due to the new MTP format that the Kindles are using. This means that you have to go through the hassle of downloading a third-party application to do simple things like update new software and side-load fonts.

Which leads me to my next issue, side-loaded fonts are no longer properly supported. You can still side-load fonts BUT every time you open a new book, it automatically defaults to the Bookerly font, even though you have saved a certain font setting. This is extremely annoying!

The next issue is that you can no longer download and transfer a book through the content settings on the Amazon website with new Kindles. If you want to download a book that you have purchased, Amazon has eliminated the ability for you to do that. WHY???
Amazon service has no answers regarding this.

Needless to say I returned this device for all of the stated reasons and guess what!?! Amazon is going to take 30 DAYS to refund me my money! I have to wait 30 DAYS to get my money back because Amazon has a defective and unsatisfactory faulty device. Not only that, but I have to make sure that somebody is home because the only return option is UPS pick up. You can no longer have the convenience of dropping it off at your local UPS store, Kohl‚Äôs or Staples. Only UPS pick up!!! Maddening! Next time if I ever purchase another Kindle, it will not be through Amazon. But yet, if new Kindles are this bad, why bother!

Now let‚Äôs talk about aesthetics and design. It seems Amazon is going backwards in their hardware. The voyage was released 10 years ago in 2014 and if you were to compare them side-by-side, one would think that the Voyage is the brand new model. Aside from the having micro USB, the Voyage has a sleeker, more premium look with page turn sensors and better materials with a micro etched glass screen instead of plastic. It also has a curved symmetrical design for better feel as opposed to a basic slab like the new Paperwhite.

Lastly, Amazon has done absolutely NOTHING to improve their software. You still have the same limitations that you did since day one. Kindles have the same limited margin settings, limited font size settings, and limited line-spacing settings.

I have a lot of side-loaded fonts that I would like to use but am unable to because they‚Äôre either too big or too small with the slightest increment in size adjustment. Absolutely ridiculous! Also, the boldness options are too thick, with slightest adjustment a font will go from too thin to too bold. A total joke!

GIVE US MORE FONT SIZES and OPTIONS AMAZON!

Needless to say, a complete NIGHTMARE! AVOID new Kindles!
