product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment: I was hesitant to buy the kindle since I love the feel of a book and seeing my bookmark inch its way to the end of the book. But after reading my first book, I am in love. The screen can be adjusted to the perfect brightness. You can make the font bigger or smaller depending on your reading needs. The metallic pink color is beautiful. It‚Äôs light and easily fits in my purse.  I don‚Äôt have to lug a backpack full of books on a flight making my backpack much easier to carry. I love the amount of storage, there is plenty of room for thousands of books. Set up was super easy and it automatically synced to my Amazon account. I love that I can just press buy and the book is downloaded at lightening speed. The charge lasts about two weeks. I can‚Äôt express how much I love this little thing. Buy it. You won‚Äôt regret it.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment: The Metallic Jade is ABSOLUTELY beautiful. The device is way faster than previous generations. I love how the font seems more crisp, the slightly bigger display, and the body quality is good. I will say the screen gets smudgy easily though with fingerprints. It types way faster as well without all the lag previous PWs had. It works well, and I haven‚Äôt had any of the extreme problems of ghosting or screen problems as of yet. Now let‚Äôs talk about the brightness. I posted a picture with my Paperwhite SE Gen 11 (happy I didn‚Äôt trade it in) and the 12th Gen SE. The 12th gen is much more warmer in color than the 11th. Both devices were on 0 warmth and 24 brightness. I don‚Äôt know if this was done intentionally to make the font more crisp but it doesn‚Äôt get as bright as my 11th gen. It‚Äôs fine as I don‚Äôt usually use max brightness anyway but for the ones who do you should know. I see reports of a yellow bar at the bottom of the screen I don‚Äôt have that. I think it‚Äôs just warmer in color in general like it was made that way. I don‚Äôt personally see many HUGE differences between the 11th gen and the 12th gen so I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs a necessary upgrade but if you have the funds to spend they are very beautiful devices!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Title: Excellent clarity and blazing speed; a worthy upgrade.
Review Comment:
The screen has excellent sharpness and contrast, the best of any ereader I've ever seen in person. It brings to mind another device that featured strikingly good sharpness and contrast despite the layers over the screen: The Voyage. I don't have one on hand to do a direct comparison, but it certainly seems to have that same sort of secret sauce going for it. I'll be very interested to see some direct comparisons from people who still have a Voyage on hand. It's not as apparent in photos, but I'm surprised at how much sharper it is than my 2021 PW. I knew from the early reviews that it would be better, but I wasn't expecting it to be so noticeable. Even my beloved Oasis comes up short in a direct comparison!

Much has been made of the speed of this iteration of the PW, and it's not just empty hype. I never thought the word "fast" would ever really apply to an e-ink screen due to the limitations of the technology, but the Kindle team has made that a reality. Pages turn as quickly as I can tap the screen, and while I've never cried out to the heavens about page turns being too slow, it's impressive to see such responsiveness on an e-ink screen. The true benefits of this speed come into play when navigating menus, adjusting settings, and especially when typing. I honestly did not think it was possible for an e-ink screen to be so fast and responsive. This is truly impressive. The speed in itself is not a reason to upgrade to this model, but if you're already considering an upgrade, it is definitely an extra enticement.

Despite the larger screen, it's very nearly the same size, measuring about a millimeter taller and wider. Annoyingly, it's just enough that the device won't fit in cases made for the 2021 model. (At least, neither of the ones I have.)

The back of the device feels very similar, just a bit slick. I still have no difficulty holding onto it. The power button is still on the bottom, and though I understand why some are annoyed by this, it's never been an issue for me. I've been using Kindles for thirteen years, and while about five of those saw me primarily using an Oasis, that's still a good eight years I used various basic and PW models. In all that time, I don't recall ever pressing the power button by mistake. So I get why it's a point of irritation for some, but it's not a mark against the device for me.

I have a Colorsoft on order, and this PW was intended as an early Xmas gift for my mom. While I set it up for her, I just couldn't resist playing around with it a bit, and it has really won me over. If I wind up not keeping my Colorsoft, I'll definitely be getting one of these for myself. The improvements are mostly small, but those little things add up to a noticeably superior experience. Despite the lack of page turn buttons, which I truly love, it just may supplant my Oasis as my main reader!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Title: Total Nightmare! QC is garbage! Return process the worst in the Industry
Review Comment:
Shopping for a new Kindle is like playing Russian roulette. You‚Äôre taking a huge gamble, taking on a big risk because the quality control is absolute garbage now at Amazon. Amazon is literally going backwards with the Kindle. This is my second Paperwhite and it‚Äôs even worse than the first. I figured why not take another chance on the premium Kindle Paperwhite signature edition thinking that it‚Äôll somehow be better, not the case. It‚Äôs even worse than the standard Paperwhite which was really bad to begin with. As a comparison, I have my Kindle Paperwhite 7th generation from 2015 that is leaps and bounds much better than this garbage new edition.

Now for a little background‚Ä¶

I have owned every Kindle starting from 2014 when I got the Voyage. Right off the bat the new Kindle Paperwhite has an overly yellow screen, meaning that the light is significantly yellow. It‚Äôs not white, it‚Äôs not even subtly opaque. But YELLOW! To make things worse, the screen lighting isn‚Äôt even even. It‚Äôs has a darker yellow band towards the bottom of the screen. This is not only my device, but across the board. This is confirmed across multiple websites, including YouTube and Amazon reviews on here. So the lighting issues not only affect the new Kindle Colorsoft, which is getting absolutely flamed for the same issue, but it also affects the new Paperwhite.

The other issue is that all new Kindles no longer support Apple computers due to the new MTP format that the Kindles are using. This means that you have to go through the hassle of downloading a third-party application to do simple things like update new software and side-load fonts.

Which leads me to my next issue, side-loaded fonts are no longer properly supported. You can still side-load fonts BUT every time you open a new book, it automatically defaults to the Bookerly font, even though you have saved a certain font setting. This is extremely annoying!

The next issue is that you can no longer download and transfer a book through the content settings on the Amazon website with new Kindles. If you want to download a book that you have purchased, Amazon has eliminated the ability for you to do that. WHY???
Amazon service has no answers regarding this.

Needless to say I returned this device for all of the stated reasons and guess what!?! Amazon is going to take 30 DAYS to refund me my money! I have to wait 30 DAYS to get my money back because Amazon has a defective and unsatisfactory faulty device. Not only that, but I have to make sure that somebody is home because the only return option is UPS pick up. You can no longer have the convenience of dropping it off at your local UPS store, Kohl‚Äôs or Staples. Only UPS pick up!!! Maddening! Next time if I ever purchase another Kindle, it will not be through Amazon. But yet, if new Kindles are this bad, why bother!

Now let‚Äôs talk about aesthetics and design. It seems Amazon is going backwards in their hardware. The voyage was released 10 years ago in 2014 and if you were to compare them side-by-side, one would think that the Voyage is the brand new model. Aside from the having micro USB, the Voyage has a sleeker, more premium look with page turn sensors and better materials with a micro etched glass screen instead of plastic. It also has a curved symmetrical design for better feel as opposed to a basic slab like the new Paperwhite.

Lastly, Amazon has done absolutely NOTHING to improve their software. You still have the same limitations that you did since day one. Kindles have the same limited margin settings, limited font size settings, and limited line-spacing settings.

I have a lot of side-loaded fonts that I would like to use but am unable to because they‚Äôre either too big or too small with the slightest increment in size adjustment. Absolutely ridiculous! Also, the boldness options are too thick, with slightest adjustment a font will go from too thin to too bold. A total joke!

GIVE US MORE FONT SIZES and OPTIONS AMAZON!

Needless to say, a complete NIGHTMARE! AVOID new Kindles!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment: Wow!  I have had nearly every version of the 12 generations of kindle at one time or another.  Each has shined in their own right from kindle keyboard to oasis and now the 12 th generation paperwhite signiture edition.  The speed with no ghosting, lightweight, screen quality, increased size, improved design make this the most impressive kindle yet!  I wanted to say that about the colorsoft, but color means comics and comics on a 7‚Äù screen just don‚Äôt work.  So when the scribe goes color, count me in.  That said, this is like a portable paperback book that is comfortable to hold with one hand and the Enjoyment of reading is unparalleled.  I have tried Kobo and even own a boox note air 4c and while each of those are great at some things, this has the whole package.  For comics I use my boox note air 4c, but the dictionary on the kindle is the best!  Adding a dictionary to kobo and boox can be done, but not the oxford concise like on the kindle.  On Boox you have to get the app, copy the word go to the app and look it up.  That is better than kobo where I had to go to my phone or paperback dictionary.  Anyway a good dictionary is a must and kindle has the whole package.  I could take a star away for the closed echo system of amazon as I would like to be able to put them on my kobo or boox devices directly, but I also want authors to get paid and I actually am ok with drm.  Torrents raise the price for those that pay so I applaud amazon for doing what they can for the authors.  I love e-ink devices and know that while I wait for the kindle scribe color, this will be my go to for novels.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment: I‚Äôve had the kindle 8 for years, and it‚Äôs been my favorite product and something I carry around everywhere I go. I got this as an early Yule present to myself and I am so glad I did. The size is perfect (compared to my old one, which was just slightly too small for me), it is so cute, and it is so much faster. I love that there‚Äôs a page turning animation and warm toning which my 8 didn‚Äôt have. It‚Äôs heavier than I thought it would be, but it‚Äôs a comfortable weight and I enjoy how it feels in my hands. I‚Äôve loved using it and it‚Äôs making me want to pick it up just to continue reading. My mom got the metallic rose and I got the jade, both of the colors are gorgeous and i am loving the update to one of my favorite items!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Comment:
This is my first Kindle and I was so excited to order. Admittedly, I don‚Äôt know much about the device, as I previously ordered ebooks from their competitors and I use a service for the blind available to me for audio books. I did some research before buying and learned of the accessibility features on the kindle, which is of utmost importance to me. I went with this version (paper-white SE) for the auto adjustable lighting and wireless charging (which I have not used yet, but plan to in the future).

As previously mentioned, I ‚Äúread‚Äù ebooks purchased from other sources and used my iPad which has a ‚Äúread to me‚Äù feature. The kindle offers a VoiceOver option, but it is not as great as the iPad feature. The number one annoyance I have with the Kindle is the non disability friendly Home Screen. WHY is enlargement and font size not accessible on the Home Screen? For someone with vision loss like myself, I can‚Äôt read anything on the main page. This is also the same struggle with the Settings page. Being able to enlarge the screen and change (or bold) the font would be helpful on the Settings screen too.  However, once I get to a book, the accessibility features such as enlarge print, spacing, etc, are acceptable and functional. I would hope products like the Kindle are evaluated and tested for wide consumer use. The blind and low vision community likes to read too, and we can, using technology which I hoped was already integrated on the device.

Moving on from accessibility, the device is lightweight, slim, and easy to carry. It even fit - with a case - in my Lululemon 2L belt bag without issue! I used it without a case for a few weeks and it was easy to hold, though did leave fingerprints on the backing (easily removed with a microfiber towel). Charging time varies, though the battery life is exceptional, having not charged for a week and not even down to half the battery. The screen moves flawlessly- most of the time, though there have been a few instances where the screen moves flawlessly ‚Äúglitched/jumped‚Äù and refreshed. It‚Äôs a split second annoyance, but otherwise it‚Äôs fine almost all of the time. Other than a case with ‚Äúwake‚Äù features, I wish I could touch screen to go from the book cover back to the book without having to push the button on the bottom of the device.

All in all, I am happy to be a new member of the Kindle family, but hope their next model is a little more advanced in accessibility features.  I would purchase again and I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to gift to a fellow reader.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle with auto-adjusting front light, wireless cha
Review Title: I really want to love it
Review Comment:
This is my first Kindle. I really like the experience of reading without a light shining in my eyes. When it is too dark to read, I like that I can change the brightness and color temperature of the light. I can take all of my books and audiobooks with me wherever I go. It‚Äôs light so it doesn‚Äôt bother my hands if I read for a long time. I like its size. However, it‚Äôs not perfect. I have some issues with the software and the hardware:

Software:

Clunky: The user interface feels very unpolished, clunky, cluttered, unintuitive, and not user friendly. It‚Äôs a mess. I wish there was a Home Screen with a Kindle app, an Audible app, a documents app, a browser app, a store, and a settings app. Instead, we have one cobbled together monstrosity trying to be all of those things at once. All of my audible books, documents, and kindle books are thrown together and you have to set filters to find things. You can set up collections but you can‚Äôt put audiobooks into collections so they clutter up the ‚Äúuncollected‚Äù folder. The OS just feels lazy, like they didn‚Äôt put much thought or care into the user experience. The swiping gestures also feel unintuitive.
Translation: I am learning a foreign language and most of what I read is in that language. When I come across a word I don‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs nice having the ability to translate that word right on the device. However, every time I need to translate a word, I have to select the word, then Wikipedia will show up then I have to scroll over to translate, then select the language menu, scroll through the list to find the language, select it, and finally I get the translation. I wish I could either get rid of Wikipedia or move it so the first thing that pops up is translation. I want to be able to download the language I am translating for use offline and delete the others from the list of available translation languages. The language detection feature rarely works. I just want to select the word and immediately see what it means.

Hardware:
Power button: Why in the world did they put the power button on the bottom of the device? This has become really bothersome. My pinky naturally rests right where the button is and the screen has turned off many times. It also means I can‚Äôt rest the device on my knee or other surface while reading.
Charging light: It‚Äôs on the bottom next to the USB-C charging port. The issue is that I read before bed so I charge it on my nightstand. The light illuminates the room which is annoying. I‚Äôd rather just have a charging symbol show up on the screen.
Material: The material feels like plastic. I read that the regular Kindle Paperwhite comes with a softer material, which I want. I paid more and feel like I got a downgrade in this area.

Also, I don‚Äôt understand why people are so upset about the lack of buttons. I love that this doesn‚Äôt have buttons.

Overall, there is so much potential in this device but Amazon is holding it back.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Comment: I was given this speaker as a gift and immediately wanted to share this awesome little giant with others. The ease of use and portability is wonderful. Its capability to fill a room with pure, clean, robust sound is impressive. I have Bose speakers in my auto and home to play CDs but had no way to get that wonderful sound for listening to a play list from my phone. I was surprised that something so small and inexpensive could play with such pure sound. Easily rechargeable and long duration of power. It is light weight and doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of space. Definitely recommend this product for young and old to enjoy !

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Title: As Good as My Bose Speaker!
Review Comment: I bought this blue tooth speaker for my show car that doesn't have a stereo. I own 2 Bose portable speakers and got this because of the good price. Wow! It does not disappoint! Music sounds great, easy to pair with my iPhone and has a fun color display. OK, the Bose speakers are little squares, smaller and a different shape than this speaker, but not a deal breaker. Also, a friend uses hers as a speaker for phone calls. I haven't tried that because I'm more interested in using it for music. It's a nice speaker.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Title: Great speaker, even better customer service
Review Comment:
This is a terrific speaker.  It connects easily, and it sounds great.  I keep it in my shower so I can listen to music or the news.  I have quite a few small bluetooth speakers, and this one is my favorite.

That being said, a few weeks after I purchased it, suddenly the speaker wouldn't power off.  It just stayed on.  When I disconnected my phone from it, it would stay in pairing mode with its blue light flashing.  This honestly didn't really bother me -- I just paired my phone to it the next day and it worked fine.  The problem came when the battery was dying.  It started beeping incessantly to alert that it needed charging, so then I had to run to plug it in to stop the beeping.  This got old REALLY fast.  I contacted the seller, and another speaker was promptly sent to me.

Terrific speaker, terrific price, terrific customer service.  You can't go wrong with this speaker.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Title: Does not connect to all TVs
Review Comment:
I recently purchased a pair of Bluetooth speakers to enhance my home viewing experience, particularly for connecting to my TV and creating a more theater-like atmosphere. While I encountered some challenges with connectivity to my Onn TV, the overall performance and quality of these speakers have left me quite satisfied. Here‚Äôs a detailed review based on my experience.
Setup and Connectivity
The initial setup of the Bluetooth speakers was straightforward and user-friendly. Connecting them to my other TV was a breeze; I simply powered on the speakers, activated Bluetooth on the TV, and they paired instantly. However, I did face issues connecting them to my Onn TV. I suspect this is due to compatibility limitations with the TV itself rather than a fault with the speakers. For anyone considering these speakers, it‚Äôs worth checking your device‚Äôs compatibility to avoid similar issues.
Sound Quality
Once connected, the sound quality of these Bluetooth speakers truly impressed me. They deliver rich, clear audio that significantly enhances the viewing experience. The bass is robust without being overwhelming, providing a well-rounded sound profile that makes movies and music come alive. Whether I was watching action-packed films or listening to music, the audio clarity and depth exceeded my expectations for speakers in this price range.
Design and Build Quality
The design of the speakers is sleek and modern, fitting well into any home decor. They are compact enough to not take up too much space but still powerful enough to fill a room with sound. The build quality feels solid, which gives me confidence in their durability over time.
Price Point
One of the most appealing aspects of these Bluetooth speakers is their affordability. At under $10, they offer exceptional value for money compared to many other options on the market. There are certainly more expensive speakers available that boast additional features or brand prestige, but for someone looking for quality sound without breaking the bank, these speakers are an excellent choice.
Conclusion
In conclusion, while I did encounter some connectivity issues with one of my TVs, the overall performance of these Bluetooth speakers has been highly satisfactory. They provide excellent sound quality, are easy to set up, and come at an unbeatable price point. With so many Bluetooth speaker options available today, finding one that balances quality and affordability can be challenging, but these speakers do just that. I would recommend them to anyone looking to enhance their audio experience at home without spending a fortune. Overall, I am quite happy with my purchase!

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Comment:
I have the unfortunate task of needing to clear out my parents' estate. There are a few large shop buildings on the property and they're all full of stuff that needs to be sorted through, trash tossed, and everything else readied for auction. This means long hours over several months, and I really need music to distract me while I work. I was able to get by just on my phone speaker, but when the weather turned hot, I had to employ some fans and the ambient sound was drowning out my phone. So off to Amazon I went in search of a speaker that could boost my music. I opted for this speaker by, BolaButty, and I'm really glad I did.

The sound is incredible! Clarity is great, volume level caries over the droning of large fans, and I have had no issues at all with connectivity. The lights really aren't my thing, but they're neat and work well. Battery life is enough to get me through at least a twelve hour day, which is helpful. I also noticed that the speaker shuts down after several minutes of not being used, so if you forget to turn it off, it's no big deal.

I can easily recommend this BolaButty speaker if you need to boost the volume of your music for whatever situation you may need.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Comment: Got this on sale a few weeks ago. It's been pretty durable and been using it in high moisture areas no problem. The base volume gets pretty high but I've been amplifying it with the power amp app on the phone to get 6-8x louder. The base power it lasts like 6-10 hours but making it go louder than it should I get 2-4 hours. Easily portable and been thinking of 3d printing a clip to attach it to my pants while working. It managed to stay connected 50 feet away and through 2 concrete walls. The connection distance is based on both devices tho but the speaker itself has good range.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Comment: I have no complaints with this. For $20, you really can‚Äôt beat it. It was super easy to set up and connected right away to my phone . It‚Äôs a decent weight too and feels sturdy. I love the sound quality too. The battery life is impressive as well. Overall, it‚Äôs a great purchase and perfect for my apartment.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Comment:
It‚Äôs a nice product. Connects easily and quickly to my transmitting device. Battery life is exceptional. The volume is also very good. I have not tried it in the shower, but it seems the seal around the USB-C ports is very tight. It also sports an aux. port (which I haven‚Äôt used yet). Downsides: when turned on it automatically
sets off of various colored light show, which can only be turned off by pushing the light switch four times; the bass response is rather muddy and highs are less than optimal; the ‚Äúon‚Äù light for the unit is on the top,
annoying when using the speaker while watching a movie‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs bright and is placed on top of the triangular shaped body. This might jus be nitpicking, but I thought I should note it. Other wise it is a good overall speaker. It‚Äôs hefty without beating heavy. It feels like it‚Äôs made quite sturdily. This is a good device for all but the most staunch audiophile.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Title: Good sound quality and battery life (within reason)
Review Comment:
Over the years, I have had multiple Bluetooth (and non-Bluetooth) portable speakers foisted on me for various reasons, so while I'm not exactly an audiophile, I have a fairly decent range of experience with these things for the average person.

This is definitely one of the better ones ESPECIALLY at this price point. If you're willing to drop whatever cash you need to to have the best sound possible, you can certainly get better. But for the cost of a sit-down restaurant meal for one person? Not likely.

Sound quality is GOOD but not GREAT. Sound carries really well. Sitting in my living room, I can hear it clearly even at low volume from the bedroom. In my office at work, I can hear it from down the hall. The specs say it can stay connected to its Bluetooth source for 33 feet, but I had it connected at nearly 50, and it was still working (although it started to get spotty before I realized my phone was in my pocket). When I used it at a tabletop game store, it drowned out everybody else's speakers even at low volume.

Battery life seems to be about 4 hours at low volume before it starts complaining. It charges fairly quickly.

It FEELS very cheap when you hold it, so I'm not sure how much of a beating it can take. Not that it's expensive enough that you have to buy it a carrying case (the case would likely cost more than the item), but you should probably be gentle with it.

I have not tested its supposed waterproof capabilities (and don't intend to, because why on earth would I?).

Assuming it doesn't break in the near future, I'd be willing to buy this again, and would be comfortable recommending it to others as a good casual speaker.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/O
Review Title: Works great out of the box
Review Comment: I use this for a class of people learning English as a second language, because the course book is associated with a free app that makes audio available online for listening and speaking practice. The speaker can be controlled from my phone screen via Bluetooth. The connection was easy to set up. The speaker's volume & clarity are plenty for the room. (Some class members are nearly 20 feet away from the speaker because the room is long & narrow.) There is a button on top of the speaker that you can press several times to shut off the flashing lights that are built into the speaker. That is very helpful, for my purpose of teaching a language to a group of adult learners. I cannot speak to durability yet, because I've only used it for 2 hours. It charges with a USB-C cord.  I don't know yet whether the battery can be replaced, but I don't see an open-able lid so I suspect the end of the battery's ability to hold a charge will be the end of the product's life.  Bottom line: good value for the price I paid on Amazon.

product_title: 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Widely Outlets with 4 USB Ports, 3 Side Outlet Extender with 6 Feet Extension Cord, Flat
Review Comment: The 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip with 8 outlets and 4 USB ports has been a fantastic addition to my home office setup. This power strip is exactly what I needed to keep all my devices powered and organized, and it has exceeded my expectations in both design and functionality. It‚Äôs perfect for anyone needing a compact, efficient charging solution with plenty of outlets and USB ports. The design is smart, the build quality is excellent, and it keeps my devices powered without any hassle. Highly recommended for anyone looking to tidy up their workspace or home setup!

product_title: 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Widely Outlets with 4 USB Ports, 3 Side Outlet Extender with 6 Feet Extension Cord, Flat
Review Comment:
The four USB ports are a lifesaver for charging my phone, tablet, and even my Bluetooth headphones simultaneously. The three side outlet extenders are genius additions, providing extra space for larger plugs without blocking the others. Plus, the flat plug design ensures it stays flush against the wall, saving precious desk space.

I also love the 6-foot extension cord, giving me the flexibility to position the power strip exactly where I need it. The wall mount option is perfect for keeping it off my desk, maintaining a clean and clutter-free workspace.

However, the surge protector can feel a bit bulky, making it a tight squeeze in some wall sockets. Additionally, the power indicator light is bright, which can be a minor annoyance during late-night work sessions.

Overall, the 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip is a powerhouse of convenience and organization. It‚Äôs perfect for anyone tired of battling with limited outlets and tangled cords. A solid 5-star rating for its functionality and space-saving design, with a tiny star lost to its occasional bulkiness.

product_title: 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Widely Outlets with 4 USB Ports, 3 Side Outlet Extender with 6 Feet Extension Cord, Flat
Review Comment:
This power surge protector is an absolute lifesaver! Not only does it double as an extension cord, but it also has USB and USB-C slots, making it incredibly versatile for all my devices. The design is really smart with outlets placed on different sides, which keeps everything organized and avoids bulky plugs from getting in the way of each other. I have my gaming PC, fish tank, and reptile setup all plugged into it, and it handles everything flawlessly without any issues.

The added USB and USB-C ports are a fantastic bonus, allowing me to charge my phone and other gadgets without needing extra adapters. It‚Äôs a solid, well-made product that gives me peace of mind, especially with all the electronics I have hooked up. Overall, this surge protector is perfect for anyone looking for a reliable, multi-functional power solution. Highly recommended!

product_title: 6 Ft Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Widely Outlets with 4 USB Ports, 3 Side Outlet Extender with 6 Feet Extension Cord, Flat
Review Comment:
I now have 5 of these YISHU Surge protectors. I've never really put energy into researching surge protectors until I was creating my own workspace and needed power outlets where there were none. I wanted to maintain the aesthetics of the space and get surge protected power where I needed it.
1. Someone thought about the design of this little guy for longer than whoever designed the atrocious looking 14" x4" black, clunky, surge strips we're all used to seeing in offices and workspaces. The design is both utilitarian and pleasing in the event it cannot be hidden from view. It's slim profile in the outlets, cord, and plug, allow for the unit to be mounted out of sight (and remain accessible and useful,) but when it cannot be easily mounted/hidden, it's not an big ugly power strip.
2. The spacing of the outlets was considered as out gadget plugs become more and more cumbersome - AND almost as a little utilitarian bonus, you have USB-A + C along one edge! This thing just keeps getting better!
3. The cords of yesteryear were big, bulky, immovable, snakes that were so cumbersome they became a workplace hazard and OSHA requires even bulkier plastic covers to be placed over the cords to prevent trip and fall injuries. This cord is just as strong, but easier to maneuver into small spaces and lays flat against the wall or floor. I just can't believe it took this long for someone to bring such a useful, thoughtfully designed necessity to our lives. Thank you YISHU! You've exponentially increased the usability of my workspaces with your easy to use and unbelievably thoughtfully designed surge protectors. Well done.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Comment:
I have the Kindle Basic 11th generation. I had the paper white 11th generation but I gave it to my niece because it was hurting my eyesight. It was too bright and a bit hazy - even in dark mode. I did not enjoy the reading experience. I also owned the Libra Colour but returned it. I didn't love it as much as I thought it would. I prefer not using turn page buttons. And it is not up to par with any Kindle, I'm sorry to say.  I will not be purchasing the Colorsoft because it's pretty much the same
 color ink technology as the Kobo. Color is a nice novelty but not a necessity. It's also not necessary to upgrade to the new Kindles. But, oh...what a difference than it's predecessor. The design of the device fees good to hold and is a very cozy experience. The display is a bit larger, the rounded corners are seamless. The screen looks crispier (clearer) but easier on the eyes. It's like you are reading on paper - not a stark white tablet screen. Dark mode is also easier on the eyes. It is also fast! For an e-reader and definitely faster than the previous paperwhite. No other technology can
beat reading on a Kindle device. If you are sensitive to blue light or get migraines - this upgrade is worth it. Its an excellent e-reader.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: THIS OASIS OWNER LOVES THE NEW PAPERWHITE!!
Review Comment: I have been using my Oasis daily for 7.5 years and the battery life is not so good any longer and the famed buttons aren't working so well anymore either! After the release of the new Kindles and the lack of one with the physical page turn buttons I decided to order the new Paperwhite and I LOVE it and encourage other oasis owners to give it a try and get over the buttons! This Paperwhite is crisp, lightweight, and very fast in turning the pages.....I couldn't really ask for more. I never had a glare problem with any of my previous Kindles so I can't speak to that. I would encourage people to use dark mode if they are subject to migraines/headaches....I used to be only able to read for about 20 minutes and then my migraine pain would start but when Amazon came out with dark mode years ago that problem went away completely....it also does away with the screen too yellow problem others talk about, even though you can control that with the warm light slider control.  People seem to just nit pick the new Kindles and I just don't share their complaints...I have never had a problem with location of the power button & another user complained that you can't clean the screen of this Paperwhite because it will just turn pages....ridiculous! On the toolbar menu at the top if you tap on the 'more' button there is an option to disable the touchscreen...tap on that and clean away, no problem! I will agree that this non-glare screen seems to show fingerprints more but I always wipe my phone screen off every morning so I just do my new Paperwhite at the same time. I read many hours a day, every day, and have had many kindles since the original in 2007 and in my opinion they just continue to get better.  I thought maybe I would miss the page turn buttons, but I do not, not at all! This new Paperwhite turns pages so easily and quickly that I don't miss the buttons....I hold my kindle on the side with one hand (and I have small arthritic hands)  and just move my thumb about a quarter inch and tap the side of the screen...it is so easy, quick and automatic that I don't even think about it.  I think people just like to complain....I love to read and this Paperwhite gives me a superb reading experience and I highly recommend it.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: Is it worth upgrading?  Unfortunately Yes, a very resounding yes!
Review Comment:
I've had my Kindle since 2013, I've probably read over 1,000 books on this little piece of equipment over the past 11 years as it's been the most convenient piece of electronics I've carried with me on my travels.  I originally bought my Kindle to replace a Sony e-reader I had because the glare on the Sony version made it impossible to use outside and in brightly lit rooms, upgrading to Amazon's Kindle was a huge game changer for me.

I've been resistant to upgrading my Kindle for the past 5 years because, why would I? My 2013 Kindle still works quite well, the battery life is very long, and sure, I need to reboot it every few weeks otherwise it's too slow to use, and yes, it has issues connecting to my wifi every other month.  These were minor inconveniences that didn't seem to be worth fixing for $150+.  Well, I received my new Kindle Paperwhite yesterday and my first thought was - wow, this is a lot lighter.  Then I turned it on and I was sold!  Lightening fast, responsive, warmer backlight, larger screen, and significantly improved contrast for sharper letters.

When I bought my first e-reader in 2011 (Sony), I had to turn it off during take off and landing. We've come a long way since then and we know that an e-reader and other small personal electronics don't impact airplane instruments and you can read away non-stop on flights.  If you're putting off upgrading an old Kindle, and you have the money to do so, don't wait, this Kindle is far superior to models made over a decade ago; and, if you haven't done so, connect your Kindle to your local library for essentially an unlimited supply of free reading material.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Comment:
I'm a relatively new e-ink convert, having bought a tricked-out Kindle Scribe exactly two years ago (when the device was brand new). Long story short? I loved that device... Literally, to death... After dropping it on terrazzo floors in SEVERAL airports world-wide, not to mention the myriad spills at home on more forgiving carpet. In fact, I loved it so much that when the 11th gen Scribe went on fire-sale a few weeks ago, I bought the cheapest version to replace my original (recently non-functional) unit, simply swapping my old premium pen for the basic one. Clearly, I loved the device enough to buy it again... I adore the ability to mark up .pdf's, the note-taking capabilities and that even with this extra functionality, it's still a very limited device that allows me to focus on reading first.

What I don't love, and never have? The weight. It's heavy to the point that I never used it if I couldn't prop it on something. Which led to it being dropped. A lot. Which led to the original unit failing. Not that it wasn't pretty sturdy... I mean, it survived repeated collisions with very unforgiving surfaces. It even weathered some relatively large liquid spills on and near it despite not being water resistant.  Now? I just use the Scribe when I need to mark up .pdf's (like, when I'm gaming... I can keep my character sheets on the Kindle), or need something that can display larger printed materials... Like RPG basic books or comics.  Hence, the new Kindle Paperwhite gen 12...

My new device isn't appreciably different than my Scribe except in a couple very important ways. The reviews don't lie... The screen contrast is higher, and in good light without backlighting, looks whiter. The device is much smaller, and seems a touch slimmer. It's also, very importantly, less than half as heavy, which means it's comfortable to hold in one hand while reading without tiring. I don't need to set it down on things, or prop it up, which reduces the threat of drops. When I'm out in public, I do have a cover for the device, and because it's so light, you can hold it open like a paperback, and it won't overbalance and fall out of your hand. The screen, given that it's half the size of the Scribe, seems to refresh much faster. It also seems to load the store faster, and settings menu navigation is measurably faster, as well. This is not surprising. The device is newer, and has less functionality. The one thing that I have detracted a star for is the battery life. I don't use the pen on the Scribe unless I'm actually writing, as it drains battery quickly. When you're turning pages with the touch-screen, however, you get exceptional battery life out of the Scribe. Not so terribly much on the Paperwhite. Granted, I'm not the average reader. 30 minutes a day is amateurish. When I use the backlight all day, I'm running down the battery at least 10% on the Paperwhite, if not more. Not a deal-breaker, by any means, but gone are the days of not bringing a charging cord for a two week vacation as I did with the Scribe.

I hear a lot of people make noise about the format... AKA, the Paperwhite doesn't have the extended lip on the side like the Oasis to make it easier to hold, and that it doesn't have buttons. Well, I understand that personal preference is personal preference, but... Who the heck wants another point of mechanical failure on a device that goes through a lot of punishment in public? I don't want my precious page-turn button breaking. Ever. And, let's face it... That's why everything is touch-screen these days. Yes, you might have to clean the screen more often, or bother to wash your hands before using your precious device (which you really SHOULD be doing, anyway), but these aren't exactly deal-breakers. Another thing that's come up even in professional reviews is people "accidentally" activating the bottom button. The question I have is, HOW?!? You need to alter your grip for leverage to depress it, the device is so light. The only other thing I've mused on is that the Paperwhite is just a plain plastic thing. It doesn't have the flashy aluminum back-side of the Oasis or even the Scribe... It doesn't look as luxe in the hand. And honestly? After the durability and weight issues I've mentioned above, I just plain don't care. If I'm in public, my device is in a case, anyway. I'm not an Apple person. While I experience SOME e-vanity, I don't think of my Kindle as a fashion accessory. Rather the opposite, as some people judge one harshly for going with an Amazon device in the first place. I'm here to read, and you probably are too if you're bothering to read this review.

All in all, it took less than a week for the Paperwhite to become my favored reading device for its' portability, its' weight and its' utility. I love the tiny thing! I look forward to years of care-free, comfortable reading without worrying so much about dropping my favorite note-taking device and general scratch-pad, the Scribe.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Comment:
I am a news junky. I mostly watch TV, read newspapers, and read lots of online news websites.  I have not been a fan of reading books, but with this Kindle that is starting to change.  This makes reading easy and enjoyable.

I can only comment on my 2024 Kindle Paperwhite, but I don't see most of the issues cited in some 1-star reviews as showstoppers.  I find the ads on the cover screen are a minor inconvenience and certainly not worth spending $20 to eliminate.  The adds don't draw any power draining the battery, and they disappear as soon as you open a book to read.  Comments about a yellow tint surprise me, especially one review that included a picture that showed a definite yellow tint.  The reviewer had the warmth setting partially on, and of course, the screen had a yellow tint.  Set warmth to zero and brightness to 80% or more, and the screen background is what most people would consider paperwhite. I might turn on warmth and reduce screen brightness when reading in bed, in a dark room next to my sleeping wife, but I am very happy with the screen white color and readability.

I purchased the optional 9W charger, and it took my battery from 50 to 99% in about an hour and a half.  It is a nice charger block.  It annoys me companies no longer supply free power cubes, but even Apple stopped supplying power cubes with their iPhones.  So, it is what it is.  I didn't wait for 100% because Li batteries are stressed and take a long time to get through the last bit of charging to get to absolute 100% charge.

The Amazon branded cloth cover is very nice, maybe a bit overpriced, but you get what you pay for.  The cover color perfectly matches the color of my kindle, it is thin and lightweight, fits snuggly, and it folds back out of the way when reading.  Compared to the old cover on my 2nd gen Kindle, this this one is much less bulky.  The texture of the cover makes it less likely I will drop it on the floor.  I'm glad I went with the Amazon cover.  Make sure you are ordering the correct cover.  If you buy a 2024, 12th edition Kindle, make sure you buy the cover for the 2024 Kindle, and not the 11th edition.

A word about the trade-in offer.  I found it a bit confusing.  It said 20% off with trade-in, but when I chose the trade-in, it only appraised the value of my very old 2nd gen Kindle at $5. I assumed the 20% was a max trade-in, but they gave me 20% off plus $5.  With the black-Friday pricing, it was  a great deal.

There was an offer on the webpage of three months free Kindle Unlimited, but after I worked through the trade-in and chose the three piece bundle (Kindle, cover, and charger). the offer disappeared.  When I received and turned on my Kindle for the first time, the same offer came on the screen.  So, no harm done.  Overall, I really like the new 2024 Paperwhite.  I highly recommend it.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: Kindle Paperwhite 12th Gen: The Ultimate E-Reader for Every Book Lover
Review Comment:
Title: Kindle Paperwhite 12th Gen: The Best E-Reader Just Got Better
Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (5/5)

The 12th generation Kindle Paperwhite continues to cement its place as the top choice for e-readers, combining sleek design, enhanced functionality, and a user-friendly reading experience. With notable improvements from previous models, this version is ideal for both avid and casual readers.

Display & Design:
The Kindle Paperwhite 12th Gen features a 6.8-inch glare-free display, which makes reading under direct sunlight or low-light environments a breeze. The larger screen compared to previous models gives more room for text, making the reading experience feel more like a real book. The warm light adjustable settings are a welcome addition, perfect for those who enjoy reading at night without straining their eyes. Plus, it‚Äôs thin, lightweight, and portable‚Äîgreat for travel or cozying up at home.

Performance:
With a smoother, faster page turn experience, this Kindle delivers snappier performance than its predecessors. The extra speed is especially noticeable when flipping through books or browsing the Kindle Store. Battery life is impressive, lasting up to 10 weeks on a single charge, making it the perfect companion for long trips without needing to worry about recharging.

Waterproofing:
One of the standout features is its IPX8 waterproof rating, allowing you to comfortably read by the pool or in the bath without fear of damaging the device. This level of water resistance gives peace of mind for readers who like to take their Kindle everywhere.

Storage & Connectivity:
With 8GB or 32GB options, there‚Äôs plenty of space for thousands of books, PDFs, and audiobooks. Audiobook lovers will appreciate the seamless integration with Audible via Bluetooth headphones, making it easy to switch between reading and listening. The device also supports Wi-Fi and some versions have a cellular option, so you can download books on the go.

User Experience & Features:
Amazon‚Äôs Kindle ecosystem continues to offer useful features like Word Wise, X-Ray, and Goodreads integration. The 12th Gen Kindle Paperwhite also supports Kindle Unlimited and Prime Reading, giving access to an endless selection of books. If you‚Äôre an avid reader who enjoys highlighting, taking notes, or adjusting fonts, the Paperwhite‚Äôs intuitive interface and customizable features won‚Äôt disappoint.

Final Thoughts:
The Kindle Paperwhite 12th Gen is a solid upgrade from previous versions. It combines all the elements of a great e-reader‚Äîlong battery life, a glare-free display, waterproofing, and storage options‚Äîwith additional performance boosts that make reading even more enjoyable. Whether you‚Äôre reading by the beach or in bed at night, the new Kindle Paperwhite continues to be the go-to device for readers everywhere.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Comment:
As this just came out, 4 days ago, all the reviews complaining about buttons or their kindle dying after months are just white noise about other kindle models. So lets review THIS model.

The sliding response time is slightly slower than a phones and dragging your finger fully across the screen only gives you 1 single page turn. Not ten, you won't be missing chunks of the book you are reading because you moved your finger a bit. In fact it seems to only turn the page after you slide roughly an inch either left to right.

However single taps are only slightly less sensitive than the average phone, so if you repeatedly tap left or right you'll flip through pages quickly. Make of that what you will.

The feel of the screen is lovely, in the image I tried to capture the texture of the screen using a bright light, it didn't reflect the light much so it does have that glare-free thing going for it.

The screen brightness and contrast is nice, I can't speak to what it once was but it is more slightly yellow than my phone at max white, and that helps with eye-strain, but perhaps not aesthetic for some. While I've yet to need bifocals that day is coming soon so I personally prefer the ability to read longer without discomfort.

As for longevity and battery life, again this bad boy was released on Oct 16, 2024 and today is the 20th. I can say I charged it, connect to wi-fi- and downloaded a bunch of audio-books and various books and then read 15% of a book with the brightness at half and I'm at 95% battery life, which doesn't seem bad for the amount of downloading this did.

Weighs about as much as my phone with a case on it, is easy to read at angles, is easy to navigate and quick to wake up. Wish I'd timed how fast it charged but I plugged it in a made some bread and it was charged fully from 57% when I was done.

Overall I am loving my purchase and glad I waited for the new one.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: Perfect to Save Space in Bag
Review Comment: I‚Äôve been carrying around a couple books at a time lately. Finally gave in and bought this. I‚Äôve been able to read everywhere, even the car. The bright daylight did not affect my reading. It‚Äôs so lightweight that I can have it up in front of me, compared to me trying to do that with a 600 page book. I also love the ability to purchase books through it, compared to how I had to get on the website if I was using the kindle app on my phone. I love the jade color, and I love the grip and texture. Won‚Äôt fall out of my hands. Such a great thing to have.

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: A few quirks but still great
Review Comment:
I should preface this by saying this Kindle is my third paperwhite (I've also had the Fire and a regular Kindle before that) and my Kindle is in my top 5 of my beloved possessions.

However, I'm a bit frustrated with the set-up on this one. Some of this is operator error -- I've been trying to download too many books at a time, which keeps freezing up the system. So that's on me (and why this version currently gets 4 stars instead of 3). But when I first registered my device (which went smoothly) and then opened up my library, I discovered all but a handful of my books (of which I have well over 2000) were showing up as unread or partially read even though I currently only have 2 unread books. At first I hoped that the system would catch up (this was prior to me downloading books onto the new Kindle) as my content library on Amazon showed the books correctly marked as "read", but that didn't seem to happen so I manually went through and marked them all as read. To be fair, I found a few errors in my organizing in doing this so was able to fix a few things. Still, it was a frustration and time consuming. I should note that I did check for and ran the update when I first started the Kindle, too.

After two restarts to unfreeze the Kindle (again, probably my fault from trying to download too many books at once) plus a third one when the screen suddenly prompted me to register my device again (after having already done it and having 775 books already downloaded), I am going much more slowly on downloading so hopefully the rest of the process will finally go more smoothly.

One other quirk was a couple books that had been placed in collections suddenly showed up in the uncollected folder. Not sure if I somehow accidentally removed them from their collections (don't see how, though) or what was going on.

Oh one other quirk I nearly forgot was that my library was showing that I had 42 library books even though all had been long returned. So I also had to re-return them as part of the process of getting this Kindle ready to use.

I'm guessing this next concern is because it was trying to download books last night, but it was fully charged at around midnight and when I checked it about 8am this morning, it was down to 7% battery charge.

I'm hopeful all will be fine when all is said and done, but what I thought was going to be an hour long process is well into the double digits of hours with work left to be done. Ah well, I'm sure once it's all done and I can focus on reading, this frustration will simply be an unpleasant memory.

Update: All is forgiven with the above noted issues as it is easier to use, the screen is nice sized so easier to read...just wonderful!

product_title: All-new Amazon Kindle Paperwhite (16 GB) ‚Äì Our fastest Kindle ever, with new 7" glare-free display and weeks of battery life
Review Title: 7" screen compared to 6" is really nice
Review Comment:
I had the kindle touch, kindle keyboard, and kindle DX from 2011-2018 at which point the battery and screen were still fine, but they stopped being able to connect to 3G or wi-fi of any sort, and side-loading books was a pain.

In early 2019 I got the Paperwhite 10th generation, which was really nice (300 dpi made a BIG difference, although I pined for the large screen of the DX).

When Amazon sent me a blurb to meet the new kindle family, I decided to get the 12th generation kindle paperwhite in teal (it is more of a turquoise/aqua, NOT a jade green, just saying) regular (non-signature) edition.

My other paperwhite still works so I decided to keep it and not trade it in.  This paperwhite isn't much more yellow, which is great (I don't like the yellow hue).  If I turn off the warmth, it looks VERY similar to the 10th generation.  I don't read at a beach or bathtub or pool so I'm not going to test the waterproof feature.

The kindle is very thin, and I felt sometimes on the 6" screen that I was speedreading without meaning to (I only read fiction, and I have the font at 6 bookerly).  This 7" screen is really nice.  It feels more natural and I can immerse myself better.

Also, imagine to my delight that when I set the kindle up I offered me three months of free kindle unlimited.  The selection on that plan has really expanded and I have a big wishlist (smiley).

I declined the audible 30 day free trial, but it offered that, too.

Now I'm just waiting for the snap back/magnetic front cases to have some pattern that I like.

I usually don't upgrade things until they break (still using a 4 1/2 year old iphone SE 2020 and 2019 ipad) but I'm really happy that I decided to just treat myself to this kindle.

My other kindle (the 2019 paperwhite) is nicknamed awesome kindle in my account; this one I nicknamed beautiful kindle.

I hope everyone else loves their kindle as much as me (and yes, I still read physical books, too).  I remember learning how to read; it opened a whole new world to me.  I don't read to the point of being anti-social (LOL), but I definitely enjoy it on the bus, on my lunch hour, and relaxing at home, and in much downtime (single, no kids, basic 40 hour a week job).

Thank you for reading.  I know many people are commenting on the kindle and I just felt inclined to join in.  I liked the keyboard, but physical buttons aren't a dealbreaker for me, and I also don't have trouble with the button on the bottom.
